data.title: Introduction
data.text:
GroupDocs.Parser allows you to extract data from your documents. It is easy to define a template with predefined fields and then extract data from your documents with it. The templates are stored on your computer in your browser storage. It is easy to upload new documents and apply your templates to automate document processing.

To extract data please define text fields. The Text field represents a rectangular area on the document page from which the text is extracted. Each field has a unique name. Text fields are grouped by templates.

By default, the template is empty. Once you add a new field, the template is stored on your computer with the template name. You can change this name (so you can easily find and load it later).

The next articles show how to extract data and work with fields and templates.

data.title: How to add a field
data.text: The field defines a rectangular area on the document page to extract a text. To add a field click Add text field button.

data.title: How to move a field
data.text: To move a field press the left mouse button inside the rectangular area and move the cursor to the destination position. Then release the mouse button.

data.title: How to resize a field
data.text: To resize a field press the left mouse button inside one of four rectangular areas. Move the mouse cursor to resize a rectangular field area. Then release the mouse button.

data.title: How to rename a field
data.text: To rename a field double click to the field or click Rename the field button. Then type a new name and press Enter or click Save button.

data.title: How to remove a field
data.text: To remove a field select it. In the context menu click the button with recycle bin image.

data.title: How to download parsed data
data.text: To download parsed data click Download as CSV button.

data.title: How to rename a template
data.text: To rename a template click Rename the current template button. Then type a new name and press Enter or click Save button.

data.title: How to download a template
data.text: To download a template click Download the current template button. This file you can use on other devices.

data.title: How to remove a template
data.text: To remove a template click Remove the current template button.

data.title: How to upload a template
data.text: To upload a template click Upload the existing template button. Then select a template from your computer.

data.title: How to create a template
data.text: To create a template click Create a new template button.

data.title: How to manage templates
data.text: To manage templates click â‰¡ button. This list contains all of stored templates. You can rename, delete or download any template. To do this hover (or tap) on the template row and click the corresponding button. To load a template double click to it.

data.title: How to add a table
data.text: The table defines a rectangular area on the document page to extract a table data. To add a table click Add table button.

data.title: How to resize a table
data.text: To resize a table press the left mouse button inside one of four rectangular areas. Move the mouse cursor to resize a rectangular field area. Then release the mouse button. Or press and hold the left mouse button on any of four edges of the table, then move the mouse cursor.

data.title: How to add a column separator
data.text: To add a column separator click + button on the left (right) of the table. Separator is created on the left (right) edge of the table. Then drag the created separator between table columns.

data.title: How to remove a column separator
data.text: To remove a column separator move the mouse cursor to it. In the context menu click the button with recycle bin image.

data.title: How to parse a table
data.text: To parse data click Parse button. Then click Show Table button to view the table data.
